parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Visual Studio Team Services account.

get.description: Returns available widgets in alphabetical order.

ownerId.description: Owner for a dashboard. For any legacy dashboards, this would be the unique identifier for the team associated with the dashboard.

DashboardGroupEntry.description: Dashboard group entry, wraping around Dashboard (needed?)

DashboardGroupEntryResponse.description: Response from RestAPI when saving and editing DashboardGroupEntry

height.description: Height of desired lightbox, in pixels

resizable.description: True to allow lightbox resizing, false to disallow lightbox resizing, defaults to false.

width.description: Width of desired lightbox, in pixels

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.  Example: { self: { href: "http://localhost:8080/tfs/DefaultCollection/_apis/wit/workItems/1" } }

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

SemanticVersion.description: versioning for an artifact as described at: http://semver.org/, of the form major.minor.patch.

major.description: Major version when you make incompatible API changes

minor.description: Minor version when you add functionality in a backwards-compatible manner

patch.description: Patch version when you make backwards-compatible bug fixes

TeamContext.description: The Team Context for an operation.

project.description: The team project Id or name.  Ignored if ProjectId is set.

projectId.description: The Team Project ID.  Required if Project is not set.

team.description: The Team Id or name.  Ignored if TeamId is set.

allowedSizes.description: Refers to the allowed sizes for the widget. This gets populated when user wants to configure the widget

artifactId.description: Refers to unique identifier of a feature artifact. Used for pinning+unpinning a specific artifact.

contributionId.description: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget Configuration.

dashboard.description: Optional partial dashboard content, to support exchanging dashboard-level version ETag for widget-level APIs

WidgetMetadata.description: For V1, this is just a pool of definitions describing our possible Widgets.

analyticsServiceRequired.description: Opt-in boolean that indicates if the widget requires the Analytics Service to function. Widgets requiring the analytics service are hidden from the catalog if the Analytics Service is not available.

catalogIconUrl.description: Resource for an icon in the widget catalog.

catalogInfoUrl.description: Opt-in URL string pointing at widget information. Defaults to extension marketplace URL if omitted

configurationContributionId.description: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget custom configuration UI. Null if custom configuration UI is not available.

configurationContributionRelativeId.description: The relative id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget custom configuration UI. Null if custom configuration UI is not available.

configurationRequired.description: Indicates if the widget requires configuration before being added to dashboard.

contentUri.description: Uri for the WidgetFactory to get the widget

contributionId.description: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget.

defaultSettings.description: Optional default settings to be copied into widget settings

isEnabled.description: Widgets can be disabled by the app store.  We'll need to gracefully handle for: - persistence (Allow) - Requests (Tag as disabled, and provide context)

isNameConfigurable.description: Opt-out boolean that indicates if the widget supports widget name/title configuration. Widgets ignoring the name should set it to false in the manifest.

isVisibleFromCatalog.description: Opt-out boolean indicating if the widget is hidden from the catalog.  For V1, only "pull" model widgets can be provided from the catalog.

loadingImageUrl.description: Resource for a loading placeholder image on dashboard

name.description: User facing name of the widget type. Each widget must use a unique value here.

publisherName.description: Publisher Name of this kind of widget.

supportedScopes.description: Data contract required for the widget to function and to work in its container.

typeId.description: Dev-facing id of this kind of widget.

WidgetResponse.description: Response from RestAPI when saving and editing Widget

WidgetsVersionedList.description: Wrapper class to support HTTP header generation using CreateResponse, ClientHeaderParameter and ClientResponseType in WidgetV2Controller

api-Version.name: api-version
api-Version.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '4.1-preview' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.dashboards: Grants the ability to read team dashboard information
scopes.vso.dashboards_manage: Grants the ability to manage team dashboard information

externalDocs.description: Visual Studio Team Services REST APIs
